Practical Day 4

1 Introduction

1.1 Installing all packages and loading data sets

Code 
####set-up####
#====Install tidyverse====#

if (!requireNamespace("tidyverse", quietly = TRUE)) {
  install.packages("tidyverse")
}
library(tidyverse)
── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.4
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.1
✔ ggplot2   3.5.1     ✔ tibble    3.2.1
✔ lubridate 1.9.3     ✔ tidyr     1.3.0
✔ purrr     1.0.2     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors
Code 
#====Install and load nycflights13 for flight data====#

if (!requireNamespace("nycflights13", quietly = TRUE)) {
  install.packages("nycflights13")
}
library(nycflights13)
if (!requireNamespace("dplyr", quietly = TRUE)) {
  install.packages("dplyr")
}

#====call packages====#

library(dplyr)
library(tidyr)


#====Using the flights and airlines dataset====#

data("flights")
data("airlines")

2 Questions

2.1 Re-writing the code using Dplyr

Code 
####re-write code####

dist_tbl <- flights |>          # Pipe result to next step
  filter(month == 1) |>         # Filter January flights
  group_by(carrier) |>          # Pipe into group_by()
  summarise(
    mean_distance = mean(distance, na.rm = TRUE), 
    sd_distance = sd(distance, na.rm = TRUE)
  ) |>                          # Pipe into arrange()
  arrange(mean_distance)
dist_tbl
# A tibble: 16 × 3
   carrier mean_distance sd_distance
   <chr>           <dbl>       <dbl>
 1 YV               229          0  
 2 9E               476.       334. 
 3 EV               522.       294. 
 4 US               536.       553. 
 5 MQ               566.       223. 
 6 FL               691.       142. 
 7 OO               733         NA  
 8 WN               942.       496. 
 9 B6              1062.       681. 
10 DL              1220.       644. 
11 AA              1350.       626. 
12 UA              1462.       778. 
13 F9              1620          0  
14 AS              2402          0  
15 VX              2495.        98.2
16 HA              4983          0

2.2 Question 3

Code 
####Question3####
#====Create a data frame with one carrier having only one flight====#

flight1 <- tibble(
  carrier = c("AA", "AA", "AA", "BB"),
  distance = c(1000, 1000, 1000, 1500)
)

#====Group by carrier and calculate mean and standard deviation====#

flight_stats <- flight1 %>%
  group_by(carrier) %>%
  summarise(
    mean_distance = mean(distance),
    sd_distance = sd(distance)  # NA for carrier "BB" as only one observation
  )
cat("As seen below, carriers with only one flight has a standard deviation of NA while those with a standard deviation of 0 is due to carriers having the same distances")
As seen below, carriers with only one flight has a standard deviation of NA while those with a standard deviation of 0 is due to carriers having the same distances
Code 
print(flight_stats)
# A tibble: 2 × 3
  carrier mean_distance sd_distance
  <chr>           <dbl>       <dbl>
1 AA               1000           0
2 BB               1500          NA

2.3 Question 4

Code 
####Question4####
#====average departure delay per carrier per month and reshape====#

carrier_delay_by_month <- flights %>%
  group_by(month, carrier) %>%
  summarise(avg_dep_delay = mean(dep_delay, na.rm = TRUE)) %>%
  pivot_wider(names_from = carrier, values_from = avg_dep_delay)
`summarise()` has grouped output by 'month'. You can override using the
`.groups` argument.
Code 
cat("The average departure delay per carrier per month and reshape")
The average departure delay per carrier per month and reshape
Code

2.4 Question 5

Code 
####Question 5####

prop_flights <- flights|> filter( dep_delay>0 & arr_delay <=0) |>
  summarise(proportion = n()/nrow(flights))
cat("The proportion of flights that were delayed but arrived on or before time")
The proportion of flights that were delayed but arrived on or before time
Code 
print(prop_flights)
# A tibble: 1 × 1
  proportion
       <dbl>
1      0.105

2.5 Question 6

Code 
####Question 6####
#====routes that more than one airline flies====#

route_count <- flights|> group_by(origin, dest) |> summarise(num_airlines= n_distinct(carrier), .groups = "drop") |> filter(num_airlines>1)
cat("Routes that more than one airline flies")
Routes that more than one airline flies
Code 
print(route_count)
# A tibble: 128 × 3
   origin dest  num_airlines
   <chr>  <chr>        <int>
 1 EWR    ATL              4
 2 EWR    AUS              2
 3 EWR    BDL              2
 4 EWR    BNA              2
 5 EWR    BOS              3
 6 EWR    BWI              2
 7 EWR    CHS              2
 8 EWR    CLE              2
 9 EWR    CLT              3
10 EWR    CVG              2
# ℹ 118 more rows
Code 
#====average arrival delay====#

route_delays <- flights|> filter(!is.na(arr_delay))|> group_by(origin, dest, carrier) |> summarise(aver_arr_delay= mean(arr_delay, na.rm=TRUE), .groups="drop")
route_delays <- route_delays %>%
  left_join(airlines, by = "carrier")
cat("The average arrival delay")
The average arrival delay
Code 
print(route_delays)
# A tibble: 437 × 5
   origin dest  carrier aver_arr_delay name                    
   <chr>  <chr> <chr>            <dbl> <chr>                   
 1 EWR    ALB   EV               14.4  ExpressJet Airlines Inc.
 2 EWR    ANC   UA               -2.5  United Air Lines Inc.   
 3 EWR    ATL   9E               -6.25 Endeavor Air Inc.       
 4 EWR    ATL   DL               10.0  Delta Air Lines Inc.    
 5 EWR    ATL   EV               19.5  ExpressJet Airlines Inc.
 6 EWR    ATL   UA               10.5  United Air Lines Inc.   
 7 EWR    AUS   UA                4.28 United Air Lines Inc.   
 8 EWR    AUS   WN              -11.2  Southwest Airlines Co.  
 9 EWR    AVL   EV                8.80 ExpressJet Airlines Inc.
10 EWR    BDL   EV                6.78 ExpressJet Airlines Inc.
# ℹ 427 more rows
Code 
#====worst and best average arrival delay====#

route_performance <- route_delays %>%
  group_by(origin, dest) %>%
  summarise(
    best_airline = name[which.min(aver_arr_delay)],
    best_delay = min(aver_arr_delay),
    worst_airline = name[which.max(aver_arr_delay)],
    worst_delay = max(aver_arr_delay),
    .groups = "drop"
  )
cat("The worst and best average arrival delay")
The worst and best average arrival delay
Code 
print(route_performance)
# A tibble: 223 × 6
   origin dest  best_airline             best_delay worst_airline    worst_delay
   <chr>  <chr> <chr>                         <dbl> <chr>                  <dbl>
 1 EWR    ALB   ExpressJet Airlines Inc.      14.4  ExpressJet Airl…       14.4 
 2 EWR    ANC   United Air Lines Inc.         -2.5  United Air Line…       -2.5 
 3 EWR    ATL   Endeavor Air Inc.             -6.25 ExpressJet Airl…       19.5 
 4 EWR    AUS   Southwest Airlines Co.       -11.2  United Air Line…        4.28
 5 EWR    AVL   ExpressJet Airlines Inc.       8.80 ExpressJet Airl…        8.80
 6 EWR    BDL   ExpressJet Airlines Inc.       6.78 United Air Line…       22.6 
 7 EWR    BNA   Southwest Airlines Co.        -2.13 ExpressJet Airl…       17.7 
 8 EWR    BOS   ExpressJet Airlines Inc.      -4.01 JetBlue Airways         6.87
 9 EWR    BQN   United Air Lines Inc.         10.9  United Air Line…       10.9 
10 EWR    BTV   ExpressJet Airlines Inc.      12.2  ExpressJet Airl…       12.2 
# ℹ 213 more rows
Code 
#====route with the greatest difference between best and worst performance====#

route_performance <- route_performance %>%
  mutate(delay_difference = worst_delay - best_delay)
greatest_diff_route <- route_performance %>%
  filter(delay_difference == max(delay_difference))
cat("The route with the greatest difference between best and worst performance")
The route with the greatest difference between best and worst performance
Code 
print(greatest_diff_route)
# A tibble: 1 × 7
  origin dest  best_airline      best_delay worst_airline            worst_delay
  <chr>  <chr> <chr>                  <dbl> <chr>                          <dbl>
1 JFK    ATL   Endeavor Air Inc.       1.40 ExpressJet Airlines Inc.         128
# ℹ 1 more variable: delay_difference <dbl>
Code 
#====reason for difference in worst and best performing airlines====#
cat("Different aircraft models: Some airlines may use older or smaller planes that may have more mechanical issues, affecting punctuality. In contrast, other airlines may use newer or better-maintained aircraft that experience fewer delays.
Maintenance schedules: Delays could be due to regular or unscheduled maintenance issues that might affect specific carriers more than others")
Different aircraft models: Some airlines may use older or smaller planes that may have more mechanical issues, affecting punctuality. In contrast, other airlines may use newer or better-maintained aircraft that experience fewer delays.
Maintenance schedules: Delays could be due to regular or unscheduled maintenance issues that might affect specific carriers more than others
Code 
#Aircraft Type and Maintenance
#Different aircraft models: Some airlines may use older or smaller planes that may have more mechanical issues, affecting punctuality. In contrast, other airlines may use newer or better-maintained aircraft that experience fewer delays.
#Maintenance schedules: Delays could be due to regular or unscheduled maintenance issues that might affect specific carriers more than others
